did.unittitle: Office of Housing and Residence Life records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: George Washington University. Office of Housing and Residence Life

did.abstract: Collection includes manuals, annual reports, rosters, photographs, books, and artifacts.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Office of Housing and Residence Life records, University Archives, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Series 1, 2, and 4 are closed to research for 50 years from date of record creation.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials acquired through transfers from Office of Housing and Residence Life.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Office of Housing and Residence Life of The George Washington University is under the Senior Vice President for Student and Academic Support Services. In 1997 it became part of the Community Living and Learning Center (CLCC), and the Office of the Dean of Students oversees its operation. It manages on-campus housing for students and establishes rules and procedures for governing them. Students and staff work together to ensure that life in the residence halls contributes to the growth of both individual students and the larger residence hall community through academic discourse, community discussion, responsible decision-making, and a variety of recreational and cultural events.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials in this collection include manuals, annual reports, rosters, photographs, books, and artifacts. They range in date from 1937-2003, and were transferred to the University Archives by the Director of Housing and Residence Life. Please note: Not all series are processed. Ask staff for assistance.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: Departmental files; Rosters; Watergate exhibit; and Housing and food services.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains manuals, annual reports, and Residence Hall Association materials. Topics include president's report, food service, and material related to the work of the residence hall staff. The material dates from 1962-1989. The Residence Hall Staff Manuals Include orientation, programming, drug policy, security, summer intersession policy, fire safety and bomb procedures, processes for non-payment on lease, Christmas closing policy, job descriptions, judicial system, emergency info, resident hall regulations and policies, summer storage policy, charges for damages, roster, etc.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Attached AA manual, "Hopefully, Everything about Being an AA"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains residence hall rosters. This material covers the dates 1987-90.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains framed photos newspaper articles, books, transcripts, audio cassettes, and artifacts. The material dates from 1970-74. The subject of the exhibit was the Watergate scandal. This material was part of an exhibit originally mounted in the former museum room at the Hall on Virginia Avenue. This room served as the lookout by the Watergate burgles.

Picture of Richard Nixon's last day as President. He is waving to the people before boarding the helicopter
Picture of Richard Nixon and Golda Meir, Israel's Prime Minister

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains brochures, flyers, memorandums, applications, map, surveys, apartments lease, floor plans, guides, correspondence, and job descriptions. They range in date from 1937 to 2003. The materials concern political science and the imagination; summer housing; resident assistants; room assignments; food service in residence halls; fire and emergency procedures; group housing; rules and regulations; "Stag"; specific residence halls; dedications; cornerstone ceremonies; cost of rooms; men's housing; women's housing; co-ed housing; storage; food services on campus, and off campus housing.

scopecontent.p: Two issues of the Hue and Cry, a monthly journal devoted to the dealings and doings of the Men's Residence Hall, October and December 1966.
